so when you think about looking at

translational modifications there's a

you would follow it down a specific
pathway and hopefully the goal is that
it leads to something important that you
can use therapeutically but oftentimes
it doesn't necessarily lead to that but
it helps further your understanding of
disease and so what we like to do with
our technology is to take a step back
from looking not just at individual
proteins and peptides and pathways but
to really looking at the bigger picture
of everything that's taking place in the
proteome and we think that the
technology you know has a lot of

point where we can look at whole
proteomes we can look at tens of
thousands of proteins within hours with
this technology and so what we like to
do is really use this to get a
comprehensive picture that allows us to
better understand disease that not only

information about biomarkers that can be

biggest thing with our field and
